definition: lit. pulling on the lapels exposes the elbows (idiom)/strapped for cash/unable to make ends meet
to clutch/to grab/to capture
lapel/overlap of Chinese gown/fig. bosom (the seat of emotions)/to cherish (ambition, desires, honorable intentions etc) in one's bosom
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
elbow/pork shoulder

sentences.english: With the depression of twe industry, the expenses of hotels or restaurants are beside their benefits.
sentences.chinese: 随着旅业界的不景气，宾馆和饭店也开端捉襟见肘。

sentences.english: The relegation of France from top table to scullery would be an historic post-war shift.
sentences.chinese: 法国从桌上上宾到捉襟见肘是战后一个历史性的转变。

sentences.english: These resources were already stretched thin by the new reality of financial austerity.
sentences.chinese: 这些资源在财政紧缩的新现实面前已经捉襟见肘。

sentences.english: So we became a single parent family and money got really tight.
sentences.chinese: 于是我们家成了一个单亲家庭，日子过得捉襟见肘。

sentences.english: Following the recession of tourism industry, hotels and restraunts also face the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 随着旅游业的不景气，宾馆和饭店也开始捉襟见肘。

definition: in short supply/dire/tense/critical/hard-pressed/important
income does not cover expenditure/unable to make ends meet
awkward situation/predicament
hard pressed for money/in financial straits
less capable than desirable (idiom); not as strong as one would wish/the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)
comfortably off/ample/plenty
the will is there, but not the strength (idiom)/the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
pinyin: xin1 you3 yu2 er2 li4 bu4 zu2

definition: to add hail to snow (idiom); one disaster on top of another/to make things worse in a bad situation
poverty-stricken/very poor/hard-pressed/in a predicament/embarrassed
(idiom) terribly busy/up to one's ears in work
tight fitting/hard up (i.e. lacking money)
to be deficient in sth/to be short of sth (supplies, money etc)
to be in straitened circumstances
lit. to attend to one thing and lose sight of another (idiom)/fig. to be unable to manage two or more things at once/cannot pay attention to one thing without neglecting the other
The cleverest housewife cannot cook without rice (idiom); You won't get anywhere without equipment.
pinyin: qiao3 fu4 nan2 wei2 wu2 mi3 zhi1 chui1
